title: China reserves cut extends risk rally before U.S. jobs data
text: Stimulus from China capped a strong week for global share markets on Friday, while bond buyers and dollar dealers were waiting for U.S. jobs data after their first significant selloffs in months.

title: China's central bank cuts reserve requirement ratio
text: China's People's Bank of China (PBOC) announced Friday that it was reducing the amount of funds banks have to hold in reserve, an effort to further stimulate the economy.

title: U.S. Stock Futures Climb Before Jobs Data, Powell: Markets Wrap
text:
U.S. futures climbed with Asian shares, while European stocks were steady ahead of Friday’s American employment report and remarks by Fed Chairman Powell.

title: Why 'Big Short' Investor Says Passive Funds Are Next Subprime Crisis
text: Michael Burry argues that passive strategies have distorted stock and bond prices much like CDOs did subprime mortgages.

title: Huawei shows off 'most powerful' chipset as forges ahead with 5G smartphone plan
text: Huawei Technologies showcased its chipset for a new high-end smartphone on Friday, pressing ahead with plans to launch its Mate 30 range, despite uncertainty about whether the new phones will be able to run Google's Android operating system and apps.

title: Oil producing countries would like to see higher prices from where they are now, expert says
text: Jason Bordoff, professor and director at Columbia University's Center on Global Energy Policy and former adviser to President Obama, discusses oil prices and the global energy industry.

title: Mohamed El-Erian on the bond markets: 'If you stick with the old rules, you will lose'
text: Economist Mohamed El-Erian told CNBC Friday that investors need to think differently about the global bond market.

title: US-China trade dispute is 'already in the early stages' of a second Cold War, Niall Ferguson says
text: Washington and China have imposed tariffs on billions of dollars' worth of one another's goods since the start of 2018.

title: The Comeback Power of Small Value Stocks
text: Written by: Dougal Williams | Vista Capital Partners When he competed in the 1972 Olympics, 800-meter runner Dave Wottle already shared the world record for that distance. But hobbled by injuries, he was unable to train in the weeks leading up to the Olympics.

title: How to Build a Bond Portfolio That Works
text: When you invest in bonds, do you buy individual bonds or bond funds? Unless you have a lot of money, you should probably buy bond funds.

title: Breakthrough in US-China trade talks is 'a bit optimistic,' says former commerce secretary
text: The U.S. and China have agreed to meet in early October in Washington to discuss trade.

title: Asia shares rise on trade talks hope, firm U.S. data; safe havens sold
text: Asian stocks gained on Friday, joining a global trend as investors took heart from firm U.S. economic data plans hopes a meeting between U.S.

title: Merkel hopes China-U.S. trade problems will be over soon
text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said at the start of a visit to Beijing on Friday that the China-U.S. trade war affects the whole world and that she hopes it will be resolved soon.

title: LG's G8X ThinQ is its dual screen bid to win over the high-end phone market     - CNET
text: LG hopes to boost sales with a Dual Screen attachment and an in-display fingerprint scanner.
